source: Curated from Veterans Consortium, NVLSP, ABA Military & Veterans Programs, VA OGC Accreditation, state legal aid directories
description: Legal resources for veterans seeking military discharge upgrades including pro bono attorneys, legal clinics, VA accredited representatives, and educational materials

resources.name: Veterans Consortium Pro Bono Program
resources.description: Connects servicemembers with volunteer attorneys to help with unjust discharge ratings. Provides free legal representation before Discharge Review Boards and Boards for Correction of Military Records.
resources.eligibility: Veterans discharged under conditions Other than Honorable (OTH) or Undesirable; having diagnosis of or symptoms of PTSD, TBI, military sexual trauma (MST), or other mental health condition; with at least one meritorious argument for upgrade
resources.notes: May pause intake seasonally - check website for current status

resources.name: NVLSP Lawyers Serving Warriors
resources.description: National Veterans Legal Services Program provides free expert legal help to veterans nationwide. Assists with discharge upgrades, medical retirement, CRSC, and TSGLI claims through pro bono attorney network.
resources.eligibility: Veterans who suffered from mental disorders (PTSD, depression, TBI) in service that contributed to misconduct resulting in OTH discharge
resources.notes: Serving veterans since 1981. Expert in complex discharge upgrade cases.

resources.name: Swords to Plowshares Legal Services
resources.description: Community-based nonprofit providing free legal consultation and attorney representation to veterans seeking VA benefits and discharge upgrades in the San Francisco Bay Area.
resources.eligibility: Low-income, homeless, and at-risk veterans in the San Francisco Bay Area
resources.notes: Founded in 1974. Also offers self-help resources and discharge upgrade guides.

resources.name: Veterans Legal Clinic at Harvard Law School
resources.description: Provides pro bono representation to veterans and family members in veterans and military law matters including discharge upgrades. Part of Legal Services Center of Harvard Law School.
resources.eligibility: Veterans seeking discharge upgrades or VA benefits assistance
resources.notes: Coordinates Veterans Justice Pro Bono Partnership. Also publishes Military Discharge Upgrade Legal Practice Manual.

resources.name: Public Counsel Veterans Rights Project
resources.description: Offers direct legal support to veterans seeking discharge upgrades in Los Angeles. Holds periodic clinics with pro bono attorneys to assist with discharge applications.
resources.eligibility: Veterans seeking discharge upgrades in Los Angeles area
resources.notes: Nation's largest pro bono law firm

resources.name: City Bar Justice Center Veterans Assistance Project
resources.description: Discharge Upgrade Program offers legal representation for veterans who received an other than honorable discharge. Also includes Women Veterans Legal Assistance and Veterans Naturalization programs.
resources.eligibility: Veterans with other than honorable discharge in NYC area
resources.notes: Program started in 2017. Strong focus on women veterans.

resources.name: Texas Civil Rights Project Veterans Services
resources.description: Provides civil rights legal assistance to low income veterans in Texas including discharge upgrade assistance and VA benefits denial cases.
resources.notes: Focus on civil rights aspects of discharge upgrade cases

resources.name: Bay Area Legal Services Veterans Law Center (Florida)
resources.description: Florida Veterans Legal Helpline provides advice and assistance for civil legal matters including discharge upgrades statewide. Attorneys provide advice and referrals to local legal aid.
resources.notes: Statewide helpline with local referrals

resources.name: Legal Aid of Southeastern PA Veterans Advocacy Project
resources.description: Provides trauma-informed, culturally-competent legal services to veterans regardless of length of service, component, or discharge status.
resources.eligibility: All veterans regardless of discharge status in Southeastern Pennsylvania
resources.notes: Serves veterans regardless of discharge status

resources.name: AMVETS Legal Clinic at Chapman University
resources.description: Law school clinic assisting veterans with discharge upgrade applications, VA benefits appeals, and basic civil legal claims.
resources.eligibility: Veterans seeking discharge upgrades or VA appeals
resources.notes: Law school clinical program

resources.name: Illinois Armed Forces Legal Aid Network
resources.description: Hotline providing immediate access to speak directly with an attorney regarding civil legal problems including military discharge upgrades and VA benefits.
resources.notes: Immediate attorney access via hotline

resources.name: Tallahassee Veterans Legal Collaborative
resources.description: Provides free legal consultations or referrals for all veterans regardless of income or citizenship status.
resources.eligibility: All veterans regardless of income or citizenship
resources.notes: No income or citizenship requirements

resources.name: ABA VetLex Pro Bono Network
resources.description: Web-based network connecting veterans to coordinated pro bono legal service providers. Most work focuses on discharge upgrades and VA disability benefits.
resources.notes: ABA Military & Veterans Legal Services Initiative

resources.name: ABA Free Legal Answers - Veterans
resources.description: Online platform where veterans can ask discharge upgrade or VA-related legal questions and receive answers from volunteer attorneys. Select 'ABA Federal' for veteran-specific questions.
resources.notes: Select 'ABA Federal' option for veteran questions

resources.name: VA OGC Accredited Representative Search
resources.description: Official VA database to find VA-accredited attorneys, claims agents, and VSO representatives who can assist with discharge upgrade cases and VA benefits appeals.
resources.notes: Official VA accreditation database. Search by location, name, or organization.

resources.name: National Organization of Veterans' Advocates (NOVA)
resources.description: Professional organization of VA-accredited attorneys and claims agents. Provides referrals to members who specialize in discharge upgrades and military records corrections.
resources.notes: Member attorneys may charge fees. NOVA maintains high ethical standards.

resources.name: Military Discharge Upgrade Legal Practice Manual
resources.description: Comprehensive desk reference published by ABA for attorneys and advocates to use throughout the discharge upgrade process. Covers PTSD, MST, racial discrimination, and other grounds for upgrade.
resources.notes: Available free online. Also on Lexis subscription.

resources.name: Swords to Plowshares Self-Help Resources
resources.description: Comprehensive self-help materials and how-to guides explaining the process of applying for a military discharge upgrade or change in discharge reason.
resources.notes: Includes step-by-step instructions and forms

resources.name: VA Legal Services for Veterans Program
resources.description: VA grant program funding entities that provide legal assistance to help veterans improve military discharge status or characterization of service. Funded clinics provide free services.
resources.notes: Check for LSV-funded clinics in your area

resources.name: VA Veterans Justice Outreach Program
resources.description: Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists identify justice-involved veterans and connect them with services including 150+ legal clinics nationwide that serve veterans.
resources.notes: Works with Veterans Treatment Courts and legal clinics

resources.name: Military Discharge Review Boards
resources.description: Each military branch has a Discharge Review Board (DRB) that reviews discharge characterizations for veterans discharged within the past 15 years. Veterans can apply without an attorney.
resources.notes: Free to apply. Success rates higher with legal representation.

resources.name: Boards for Correction of Military Records
resources.description: Each military branch has a Board for Correction of Military/Naval Records (BCMR/BCNR) that can correct any military record including discharge characterization. No time limit for applications.
resources.eligibility: All veterans regardless of discharge date
resources.notes: Broader authority than DRBs. No deadline to apply.

resources.name: Stateside Legal
resources.description: Online legal resource center for military members, veterans, and families. Includes state-by-state legal aid directories and discharge upgrade information.
resources.notes: Find local legal aid by state

resources.name: LawHelp.org Veterans Resources
resources.description: National directory of free legal aid programs with veteran-specific resources and referrals for discharge upgrades and VA benefits.
resources.notes: Search by state for local legal aid

resources.name: Connecticut Veterans Legal Center
resources.description: Provides free legal services to low-income veterans including discharge upgrade assistance, VA benefits appeals, and other civil legal matters.
resources.notes: Co-located with VA Connecticut Healthcare System

resources.name: National Veterans Legal Center (Virginia)
resources.description: Provides pro bono legal assistance to veterans in Virginia including discharge upgrades, VA benefits, and other military-related legal matters.
resources.notes: Focused on Virginia veteran population

resources.name: Upsolve Military Discharge Upgrade Guide
resources.description: Free comprehensive online guide explaining the discharge upgrade process including eligibility, application procedures, and common arguments for upgrade.
resources.notes: Step-by-step self-help guide

resources.name: Military Discharge Upgrade Information Portal
resources.description: Government resource portal with information about discharge upgrade rights, procedures, and recent policy changes including liberal consideration guidance.
resources.notes: Official DoD resource

upgrade_grounds.name: PTSD and Mental Health
upgrade_grounds.description: Veterans who suffered from PTSD, depression, anxiety, or other mental health conditions during service may demonstrate their condition impacted behavior leading to discharge.

upgrade_grounds.name: Military Sexual Trauma (MST)
upgrade_grounds.description: Veterans who survived MST may argue their misconduct was a result of or reaction to trauma events.

upgrade_grounds.name: Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)
upgrade_grounds.description: Veterans who suffered TBI can argue the injury caused behavioral changes that led to misconduct.

upgrade_grounds.name: Don't Ask Don't Tell (DADT)
upgrade_grounds.description: DOD guidance allows changes to characterization of service if discharge was based on DADT or prior similar policies.

upgrade_grounds.name: Racial Discrimination
upgrade_grounds.description: Studies show evidence of disparate treatment of racial minorities. Veterans may argue misconduct resulted from racial discrimination or harassment.

upgrade_grounds.name: Young Age at Time of Service
upgrade_grounds.description: Immaturity and youth at time of service can be a mitigating factor for misconduct.

upgrade_grounds.name: Outstanding Service Record
upgrade_grounds.description: Strong service record, awards, deployments, and positive evaluations prior to misconduct can support upgrade.

upgrade_grounds.name: Post-Service Good Conduct
upgrade_grounds.description: Exemplary conduct since discharge, including employment, education, community service, and rehabilitation.
